title: LEDModule
description: A Light Emitting Diode (LED) light source is often composed of multiple modules each with its own wavelenght characteristics. This element describes an individual LED module. Multiple of this elements may be used.

PeakWavelenght.description: The wavelength at which there is maximal response rate.

LumenPower.description: The amount of light this light source generate at maximum expressed in lumen. The lumen is the SI derived unit of luminous flux, a measure of the total quantity of visible light emitted by a source.

ProjectionAngle.description: The angle at which this light source projects light.

CutIn.description: CutIn is the wavelength below which the response rate is below 50%.

CutOut.description: CutOut is the wavelength above which the response rate is below 50%

WavelenghtProfile.description: The location of a file containing the wavelenght profile of this component.

Tier.description: The tier level of this component.
